text: In the ever-evolving landscape of financial decision-making, this study delves into the complex interplay between Emotional Intelligence (EI), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Investment Decisions (ID). It scrutinizes how human emotional intelligence directly influences investment choices and the mediating role of AI in this intricate process. Through rigorous empirical analysis, the study unveils that EI not only has a direct impact on ID but also exerts its influence indirectly through AI-mediated pathways. These findings underscore the vital importance of emotional awareness in investor decision-making, bolstered by AI's technological advancements. The study suggests that emotional intelligence significantly guides most investors' decisions, with AI playing a substantial role in shaping the investment decision-making process. This nuanced understanding offers valuable insights for financial practitioners, policymakers, and researchers, stressing the necessity of comprehensive strategies that fuse emotional and technological dimensions for navigating the complexities of modern investment landscapes effectively.
name: fid-048
